title: 2 Ways to Ask for Recommendations on Facebook

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Tap the app icon that looks like a white "f" on a blue background. Sign in if prompted.

steps.title: Tap the What's on your mind field.
steps.content: Tap the What's on your mind field. This will open a new window so you can create a new post. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Ask for a recommendation.
steps.content: Ask for a recommendation. According to Facebook's algorithms, if you pose a question that asks if anyone has any idea for good services or products in a specific location , the question will be marked as a recommendation. For example, “Where can I get a good burger in New York?” is a good example of a post asking for a recommendation in a specific area. [2] X Research source Make your request specific if you want specific results. Include the type of service you’re looking for in your request. For example, if you’re looking for a mechanic, you may want to specify the type of work you need done, such as an oil change or bodywork. It might be a good idea to include your budget as well, especially when dealing with restaurant recommendations. This will ensure the recommendations are appropriate for your needs. Here’s an example of a well-worded request: “Hi guys! Does anyone know of a good place for sushi in downtown Seattle? Looking for no more than $50 for two people! Thanks!”

steps.title: Post your question.
steps.content: Post your question. Once you've set the audience , publish the post so you can get responses. [3] X Research source You'll notice that the post is automatically tagged as a recommendation post.

steps.title: Go to https://facebook.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://facebook.com in a web browser. Sign in if needed. You can use any web browser on your computer to get a recommendation on Facebook.

steps.title: Click the What's on your mind text box.
steps.content: Click the What's on your mind text box. This will open a new window so you can create a new post. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Write a text-only post.
steps.content: Write a text-only post. After clicking on the status box, the text option should be selected by default. Write your request for a recommendation here. [5] X Research source The text-only post should be in a question format with a specific location and any details. For example, "Does anyone know any good lawn care services in Nashville?" is a good recommendation question.

steps.title: Publish your post.
steps.content: Publish your post. After writing your status asking for recommendations, click on the blue “Post” button at the bottom right corner of the status update box. [6] X Research source This will post the request to your wall. You will see that your post has automatically been tagged as a recommendation post. To respond, just write an "@" to tag the recommended party. If you want to ask a group, navigate to that group before you make a post.
